Then $${{\Pr obability\,\,of\,\,occurrence\,\,of\,\,{E_1}} \over {\Pr obability\,\,of\,\,occurrence\,\,of\,\,{E_3}}}$$

The net electric field at a distance $$2$$ $$R$$ from the center of the smaller sphere, along the line joining the centers of the spheres, is zero. The ratio $${{{\rho _1}} \over {{\rho _2}}}$$ can be

questions.question_text: In the circuit shown in the figure, there are two parallel plate capacitors each of capacitance $$C.$$ The switch $${S_1}$$ is pressed first to fully charge the capacitor $${C_1}$$ and then released. The switch $${S_2}$$ is then pressed to charge the capacitor $${C_2}.$$ After some time, $${S_2}$$ is released and then $${S_3}$$ is pressed. After some time
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: The charge on the upper plate of $${C_1}$$ is $$2C{V_0}$$
options.B: The charge on the upper plate of $${C_1}$$ is $$C{V_0}$$
options.C: The charge on the upper plate of $${C_2}$$ is $$0$$
options.D: The charge on the upper plate of $${C_2}$$ is $$ - C{V_0}$$

questions.question_text:
The diameter of a cylinder is measured using a Vernier callipers with no zero error. It is found that the zero
of the Vernier scale lies between 5.10 cm and 5.15 cm of the main scale. The Vernier scale has 50 divisions
equivalent to 2.45 cm. The 24th division of the Vernier scale exactly coincides with one of the main scale
divisions. The diameter of the cylinder is

questions.question_text: Two rectangular blocks, having identical dimensions, can be arranged in either configuration-I or configuration-II as shown in the figure. One of the blocks has thermal conductivity $$\kappa $$ and the other 2$$\kappa $$. The temperature difference between the ends along the x-axis is the same in both the configurations. It takes 9 s to transport a certain amount of heat from the hot end to the cold end in configuration-I. The time to transport the same amount of heat in configuration-II is

questions.question_text:
A horizontal stretched string, fixed at two ends, is vibrating in its fifth harmonic according to the equation

y(x, t) = (0.01 m) sin[(62.8 m$$-$$1)x] cos[(628 s$$-$$1)t]

Assuming $$\pi$$ = 3.14, the correct statement(s) is(are)
questions.subject: Physics

options.B: The length of the string is 0.25 m.
options.C: The maximum displacement of the mid-point of the string, from its equilibrium position is 0.01 m.

questions.question_text: A particle of mass M and positive charge Q, moving with a constant velocity $${\overrightarrow u _1} = 4\widehat i$$ ms$$-$$1 enters a region of uniform static magnetic field, normal to the xy plane. The region of the magnetic field extends from x = 0 to x = L for all values of y. After passing through this region, the particle emerges on the other side after 10 ms with a velocity $${\overrightarrow u _2} = 2\left( {\sqrt 3 \widehat i + \widehat j} \right)$$ ms$$-$$1. The correct statement(s) is(are)
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: The direction of the magnetic field is $$-$$z direction.
options.B: The direction of the magnetic field is +z direction.
options.C: The magnitude of the magnetic field is $${{50\pi M} \over {3Q}}$$ units.
options.D: The magnitude of the magnetic field is $${{100\pi M} \over {3Q}}$$ units.

questions.question: A particle of mass M and positive charge Q, moving with a constant velocity $${\overrightarrow u _1} = 4\widehat i$$ ms^{$$-$$1} enters a region of uniform static magnetic field, normal to the xy plane. questions.question_text: The work functions of silver and sodium are 4.6 and 2.3 eV, respectively. The ratio of the slope of the stopping potential versus frequency plot for silver to that of sodium is ___________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The work functions of silver and sodium are 4.6 and 2.3 eV, respectively. The ratio of the slope of the stopping potential versus frequency plot for silver to that of sodium is ___________.

questions.question_text: A freshly prepared sample of a radioisotope of half-life 1386 s has activity 103 disintegrations per second. Given that ln2 = 0.693, the fraction of the initial number of nuclei (expressed in nearest integer percentage) that will decay in the first 80 s after preparation of the sample is __________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A freshly prepared sample of a radioisotope of half-life 1386 s has activity 10^{3} disintegrations per second. Given that ln2 = 0.693, the fraction of the initial number of nuclei (expressed in nearest integer percentage) that will decay in the first 80 s after preparation of the sample is __________.
